intro: Lunathyrium lasiopteris var. kiusianum, commonly known as the Kiusianum moonflower, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, silver-white leaves that reflect light, giving it a luminous appearance. Its flowers are small, white, and bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Due to its limited habitat and conservation status, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
